discoveries.finding: Merging LoRA with fp8 model workflow
discoveries.details: Load model => load lora (like normal workflow) => save model - much easier than expected

discoveries.finding: SVI Pro difference augmentation for longer videos
discoveries.details: Can generate coherent videos up to 241 frames without running back by using scheduled difference augmentation on frames beyond typical 81 frames

discoveries.finding: SVI memory efficiency improvement
discoveries.details: Setting length to 65fps instead of 81 for each clip makes generation super fast and uses less VRAM

discoveries.finding: VAE decode yellowing fix
discoveries.details: Wan's VAE requires large/full temporal window - switch from tiled VAE decode to normal VAE decode to prevent yellowing/banding

discoveries.finding: 1022 LoRA training base
discoveries.details: The wan2.2_i2v_A14b_low_noise_lora_rank64_lightx2v_4step_1022.safetensors was actually trained on wan 2.1 model, causing 170 key mismatch

discoveries.finding: SageAttention speedup increases with generation size
discoveries.details: User confirmed that SageAttention2 provides better performance improvements on larger generation sizes

discoveries.finding: RTX 5090 performance baseline established
discoveries.details: 49 minutes for 15 videos (81 frames each, 720x1280, 6 steps) - approximately 3 minutes per video

discoveries.finding: SVI Pro has slowmotion tendency by design
discoveries.details: SVI by nature is biased towards less motion because of the anchor frame - it's always trying to get back to the anchor frame for consistency

discoveries.finding: Text encoder replacements can change model behavior without retraining
discoveries.details: Changing text encoders CAN make different behaviors even if model doesn't understand new tokens - retrained Qwen3 models work as replacements for same size models

discoveries.finding: MLP layers are sensitive to quantization in some models
discoveries.details: With LongCat, doing MLP in fp8 ruined quality completely. Wan 2.1 had crazy quality hit with fp8 matmuls on MLP but largest speed increase. Wan 2.2 seems fine with it

discoveries.finding: VAE precision bug returns on PyTorch 2.11.0
discoveries.details: Cannot decode 640x640x81, affects both wrapper and native implementations

discoveries.finding: fp32 VAE decoding uses less memory than bf16 when conv3d bug is active
discoveries.details: fp32 is 2x memory use but the bug causes 3x, so fp32 is actually better

discoveries.finding: Flash attention works on ROCm and Windows now
discoveries.details: Does small compiling with triton at first use, memory usage is lower, works with wan wrapper when flash-attention is selected

discoveries.finding: LongVie2 provides depth controlnet for I2V models
discoveries.details: Only depth controlnet available for I2V models, uses depth/spatracker tracks controlnet and can continue from 8 frames

discoveries.finding: SVI 2.0 Pro uses anchor latent to mitigate degradation
discoveries.details: The degradation was never about encode-decode process, it's natural with these models, anchor latent in SVI mitigates this

discoveries.finding: MoE ksampler ensures proper timestep split
discoveries.details: Makes sure time step split between high and low model is exactly 0.875 (standard), especially important for LoRAs limited to those timesteps

discoveries.finding: CLIP Vision Tiling improves image-to-video accuracy
discoveries.details: Breaking images into tiles allows CLIP vision to see more detail since it's capped at 256x256. Setting to 2 tiles sees 512x512 (2 tiles = 2x2 tiles essentially)

discoveries.finding: WanAnimate face detection is more stable than LivePortrait's facecropper
discoveries.details: LivePortrait's facecropper has trouble stabilizing head rotation and scale causing artifacts. WanAnimate's face detection is far more stable and produces less jittery results when used as driving video

discoveries.finding: LTX-2 works as fast Wan upscaler
discoveries.details: 1080p Wan upscale tests using LTX-2 take just over a minute each using v2v workflow. Need to reduce lora strength as it adds too much detail

discoveries.finding: Wan 2.2 low-noise model can run standalone
discoveries.details: You can use lownoise 2.2 model only if you cant fit both high and low in ram. Works better than 2.1 but real difference is using both models. 2.1 is very similar to 2.2 low

discoveries.finding: Sage made huge improvement for LTX-2, torch compilation didn't notice much difference
discoveries.details: SageAttention provided significant performance boost while torch compilation had minimal impact

discoveries.finding: FP8 numbers are discrete sets, not continuous like traditional floats
discoveries.details: Only 256 numbers with big range split into bands, mantissa determines granularity between bands

discoveries.finding: Pytorch uses caching system to avoid expensive GPU driver allocations
discoveries.details: Pytorch maintains cache of memory allocated from CUDA driver and sub-allocates from this cache to avoid constant driver-level allocations

discoveries.finding: Skip final model call can reduce inference time by 20% for low-step generations
discoveries.details: For 4-step generations, skipping final model call saves 20% time with practically no quality loss

discoveries.finding: VRGameDevGirl84 created a beat-locked auto video editor
discoveries.details: Gradio app that automatically edits multi-camera video footage to music by analyzing rhythm, energy, and structure. Uses stems to decide shots and locks cuts to musical beats.

discoveries.finding: Mocha only uses single mask that propagates automatically
discoveries.details: Mocha uses a single frame mask and propagates it automatically to the whole video, not a multi-frame mask

discoveries.finding: Can't run HuMo and SCAIL simultaneously
discoveries.details: You can run HuMo as a second pass but not at the same time in the same latent with SCAIL

discoveries.finding: VACE only works with T2V models
discoveries.details: VACE cannot be used with I2V models like SVI

discoveries.finding: SVI anchor frame should be first frame for coherent generation
discoveries.details: The anchor latent should be the first frame to get a coherent image, not the last frame

discoveries.finding: SVI Pro 2.2 can work as a LoRA with strength values 0.7/0.5
discoveries.details: User tested SVI weight at 0.7 and 0.5 with good results for video extension

discoveries.finding: ComfyUI now has asynchronous weight offloading
discoveries.details: ComfyUI offloads unused weights to RAM and juggles active weights between VRAM/RAM asynchronously, so if step compute time is long like with video models, weight moving may not slow it down

discoveries.finding: Wan 2.2 FP16 can run on 16GB VRAM despite 53GB model size
discoveries.details: Due to ComfyUI's asynchronous offloading system that manages weights between VRAM and RAM

discoveries.finding: Face similarity should be part of loss function when training LoRAs
discoveries.details: Would improve face preservation in LoRA training, described as 'crazy that people don't do that'

discoveries.finding: Embedding training on Wan 1.3B can transfer to other Wan versions
discoveries.details: Since Wan uses same text encoder for all versions, embeddings trained on 1.3B with small images could transfer to larger models

discoveries.finding: Block swap can improve speed even with smaller quants
discoveries.details: User reported 10% speed improvement using block swap with q4/q3 models, even when GPU has enough VRAM

discoveries.finding: Wrapper version 1.4.0 changed T2V outputs
discoveries.details: After version 1.4.0, T2V generates different outputs with better prompt adherence and more detailed results, but lightx LoRAs may need rebalancing

discoveries.finding: NAG memory optimizations implemented
discoveries.details: NAG node updated with optional inplace memory saving optimizations that reduce VRAM usage significantly but may slightly change output

discoveries.finding: StoryMem RoPE implementation was incomplete
discoveries.details: Original StoryMem repo was missing RoPE offset implementation in code despite mentioning it in paper, recently fixed in latest commit

discoveries.finding: WanVideo Apply NAG is not supported with Wan 2.1
discoveries.details: Removing WanVideo Apply NAG made workflow work with Wan 2.1, though it works fine with Wan 2.2

discoveries.finding: Wan distilled loras work best with shift=5
discoveries.details: They were trained with shift=5, and in general shift depends on resolution - higher resolution needs higher shift due to relationship between resolution, noise level, and signal to noise ratio

discoveries.finding: SVI 2.0 Pro can continue from latent directly without decode/encode
discoveries.details: This is one of its main features and preserves more detail than saving to disk and reloading

discoveries.finding: Every diffusion/flow model can be img2img or vid2vid with inpainting and masks
discoveries.details: This is a result of how the models work mathematically, but requires correct code tools/nodes to take advantage

discoveries.finding: SCAIL has 3D pose data
discoveries.details: Unlike VACE which was possible before, SCAIL provides better pose control with 3D data

discoveries.finding: VHS Load Video (FFmpeg) avoids color shift
discoveries.details: VHS normal loader uses opencv and causes pink/magenta color drift, while FFmpeg version maintains accurate colors like native

discoveries.finding: Self-refine-video technique implemented for Wan models
discoveries.details: Uses restart sampling with uncertainty masking to improve video quality, requires 50% more compute time but produces better results

discoveries.finding: Color shift issue identified in VHS video loading nodes
discoveries.details: VHS Load Video and Native Load Video produce color drift when loading videos, only VHS FFmpeg Load Video preserves correct colors

discoveries.finding: SageAttn provides ~90% quality with 2x speedup
discoveries.details: Using SageAttn attention mechanism gives substantial speedup with minimal quality loss, especially when combined with distill LoRAs

discoveries.finding: New UniVerse-1-Base model released
discoveries.details: Ovi-style model trained on Wan 2.1 1.3B, uses ace-step instead of mmaudio, but appears undertrained

discoveries.finding: SkyReels V3 R2V model looks identical to T2V model with no new layers
discoveries.details: The R2V architecture appears to be the same as standard T2V models

discoveries.finding: SkyReels V3 R2V model supports 4 reference images maximum
discoveries.details: Model pads with empty slots for unused reference images, max is 4

discoveries.finding: SkyReels V3 default frame count is 121 for R2V
discoveries.details: Formula is num_frames = duration * 24 + 1, default 121 frames for R2V

discoveries.finding: SkyReels V3 model appears to be distilled
discoveries.details: Model behavior suggests it's a distilled version, explains performance differences

discoveries.finding: MOVA is essentially Wan 2.2 A14B with audio, not 32B
discoveries.details: Uses two models like Wan 2.2, fully runnable on consumer GPUs, basically Ovi scaled to Wan 2.2

discoveries.finding: SkyReels V3 consists of 4 different models
discoveries.details: Includes talking avatar, shot model for extending with new shots, extend model, and multitalk weights

discoveries.finding: MOVA supports multi-shot and has better character consistency
discoveries.details: Model has better VAE, sound, Apache license, smaller text encoder

discoveries.finding: Double distillation can cause excessive CFG-like effects
discoveries.details: Loading LightX2V on top of already distilled model creates artifacts

discoveries.finding: Self-Refine is available in testing branch for WanVideoWrapper
discoveries.details: Kijai has self-refine for wrapper in early testing stages on separate branch, see self-refine-video branch

discoveries.finding: MOVA requires significant VRAM
discoveries.details: Eats ~55 GB VRAM for 94 frames 720p with memory option 'cpu' and 'bfloat16'. 72 GB VRAM / 45 GB RAM for 193 frames

discoveries.finding: MOVA performs scene cuts spontaneously
discoveries.details: MOVA made scene cuts without prompting them in the generation

discoveries.finding: Skyreels Extend model is based on Wan 2.1 720p
discoveries.details: Compared tensors and it's almost same as the base 720p model with some distill lora added, very similar to lightx2v

discoveries.finding: TalkingAvatar is 95% multitalk code
discoveries.details: Whole model code is multitalk but they don't credit it anywhere

discoveries.finding: NVFP4 conversion of Wan 2.2 i2v high reduces model size from 28GB to 7.8GB in 45 seconds
discoveries.details: Conversion completed on 5090, but models are very lossy - proper NVFP4 models need calibration

discoveries.finding: NVFP4 models provide 30% faster generation after load
discoveries.details: 4-step LoRA NVFP4 working fine with 81 frames at 24fps

discoveries.finding: MOVA is only 1-2 seconds slower per iteration compared to Wan 2.2 a14b
discoveries.details: Performance tested over in different channel

discoveries.finding: Audio models are much smaller than video models
discoveries.details: Audio to video cross-attention slows it down a bit but audio itself is fast

troubleshooting.problem: VAE decode causing yellowing/banding in videos
troubleshooting.solution: Switch from tiled VAE decode to normal VAE decode - wan's VAE requires large/full temporal window

troubleshooting.problem: SVI causing yellowing after first frame
troubleshooting.solution: Issue is with zero frame scaling in VAE - SVI uses real zero frames for I2V conditioning and ComfyUI scales them after concat

troubleshooting.problem: 170 key mismatch with 1022 low noise LoRA
troubleshooting.solution: LoRA was trained on wan2.1 model, not wan2.2 - use appropriate base model

troubleshooting.problem: ComfyUI memory crashes with SVI workflow
troubleshooting.solution: There are clear models and execution cache options under File/Edit menu, also memory leak issues with model loader

troubleshooting.problem: Random fences and gates appearing in generations
troubleshooting.solution: Usually caused by pushing LoRA too hard or excess noise - reduce LoRA strength or noise levels

troubleshooting.problem: SageAttention compiled from source crashes ComfyUI
troubleshooting.solution: SDPA works as alternative

troubleshooting.problem: Custom SVI node changing faces even without SVI enabled
troubleshooting.solution: Use native ComfyUI nodes instead of custom 'vibecoded' nodes - native works perfectly

troubleshooting.problem: LoRA key not loaded errors with SVI Pro
troubleshooting.solution: Ignore the errors - they're from 2.1 LoRA layers not present in 2.2, but rest of LoRA applies fine

troubleshooting.problem: Device mismatch error with prev_samples in SVI Pro
troubleshooting.solution: Use 'denoised' output from Clownshark sampler nodes instead of regular 'output' - it's on correct device

troubleshooting.problem: RTX 5090 power connector burning/melting
troubleshooting.solution: Don't use cable that came in box, get third party braided cable set, ensure proper PSU like Corsair RME series

troubleshooting.problem: SVI Pro nodes showing as red/missing
troubleshooting.solution: Switch to nightly build for Kijai nodes or manually pull master branch from custom_nodes/comfyui-kjnodes

troubleshooting.problem: Original SVI LoRAs don't work in native workflows
troubleshooting.solution: Use converted LoRAs from Kijai's repo specifically made for native ComfyUI

troubleshooting.problem: ComfyUI backend freezes when opening workflows
troubleshooting.solution: Open two windows (not tabs), use one to close and reopen so the working one doesn't change

troubleshooting.problem: Flickering in S2V generation
troubleshooting.solution: Was caused by bug that didn't pick up the base image

troubleshooting.problem: SVI original LoRAs not working
troubleshooting.solution: Use SVI LoRAs from Kijai's HuggingFace instead of original ones

troubleshooting.problem: Previews in subgraphs showing static images
troubleshooting.solution: Update video helper suite nodes and enable animated previews in options, use Latent2rgb

troubleshooting.problem: PyTorch 2.11.0 causing OOM on VAE decoding
troubleshooting.solution: Update CUDNN or return to stable PyTorch version, use fp32 VAE as workaround

troubleshooting.problem: Invalid buffer size error with SamplerCustomAdvanced
troubleshooting.solution: No specific solution provided, user seeking help

troubleshooting.problem: Getting stretched human-like forms with chibi characters in Wan Animate
troubleshooting.solution: Greatly expand the mask size (200+ pixels makes massive difference), position reference in same spot as pose video

troubleshooting.problem: 5090 power connector issues
troubleshooting.solution: Triple check cable is seated fully, avoid force bending, slight undervolting or power limiting to 500W, limit reconnections to ~20 times

troubleshooting.problem: SVI 2.2 Pro making black videos in landscape but not portrait
troubleshooting.solution: No definitive solution provided, one user mentioned prompt weights with SVI causing issues

troubleshooting.problem: ComfyUI-Kitchen error after updating
troubleshooting.solution: Run 'ComfyUI_Main\python_embeded\python.exe -m pip install -U comfy-kitchen' on portable installs

troubleshooting.problem: Color shift between windows in WanAnimate long generations
troubleshooting.solution: No solution provided, acknowledged as known issue

troubleshooting.problem: Slow motion issues with SVI
troubleshooting.solution: Try higher CFG for faster motion, use smoothwan model, try different lightx loras like old MOE distill lora, use 3 sampler setup where first sampler runs without lightx and higher CFG

troubleshooting.problem: SageAttention stopped working with ImportError about required packages
troubleshooting.solution: Use Triton and Sage versions from woct0rdho on Windows

troubleshooting.problem: Color match node failing with infinite 'Reconnecting'
troubleshooting.solution: Try disabling multithread option in the color match node

troubleshooting.problem: SCAIL only working with CUDA 12.8 but user has CUDA 13
troubleshooting.solution: Upgrade onnxruntime-gpu to nightly version for CUDA 13.x support

troubleshooting.problem: Context windows erroring on last step with clownshark samplers
troubleshooting.solution: Use extra_option 'skip_final_model_call'

troubleshooting.problem: Memory fragmentation in pytorch cache causing OOM
troubleshooting.solution: Pytorch cache becomes fragmented after long runs with diverse tensor sizes, limiting ability to find contiguous blocks

troubleshooting.problem: ComfyUI Manager installing wrong version of WanVideoWrapper
troubleshooting.solution: Manual installation from fresh zip instead of using manager

troubleshooting.problem: Mocha workflow failing with tensor size mismatch
troubleshooting.solution: Mask should be only on first frame, not multi-frame

troubleshooting.problem: SageAttention CUDA error on RTX 6000 Pro
troubleshooting.solution: Need to compile SageAttention 2.2 for sm_120 or find pre-compiled .whl

troubleshooting.problem: Torch compile stopped working after ComfyUI update
troubleshooting.solution: Torch compile might be broken since recent ComfyUI update

troubleshooting.problem: InfiniteTalk workflow error with more than 4 steps
troubleshooting.solution: Change scheduler to dpm++_sde or lcm

troubleshooting.problem: ComfyUI memory issues with current version causing lockups
troubleshooting.solution: Revert to ComfyUI version v0.8.2 from Jan 7 to fix VRAM overshoot issues

troubleshooting.problem: Color burn-in and detail shift in longer SVI generations
troubleshooting.solution: Use Color Match node, though it only partially helps. HPS and MPS reward LoRAs break generation flow with SVI

troubleshooting.problem: SCAIL and HuMo can't work in same workflow
troubleshooting.solution: Run HuMo as second pass in V2V mode with 0.5 or 0.8 denoise after SCAIL

troubleshooting.problem: Tensor mismatch errors with Wan 2.2 Fun VACE
troubleshooting.solution: Check model/VAE/encoder compatibility and ensure frame/resolution count matches

troubleshooting.problem: Normal maps bleeding into output with WAN2.1 VACE after 81 frames
troubleshooting.solution: Issue occurs when exceeding 81 frames in single batch at 720p

troubleshooting.problem: ComfyUI caught in reloading loop after tab refresh
troubleshooting.solution: Bug in recent frontend version, should be resolved in latest version or try going backwards

troubleshooting.problem: Black output with higher prefetch counts in block swap
troubleshooting.solution: Keep prefetch at 1, higher values cause NaN tensors which appear faster but don't actually work

troubleshooting.problem: Long loading times for transformer parameters
troubleshooting.solution: Update ComfyUI, remove conflicting nodes like 'infinitetalk' fork, disable pinned memory if needed

troubleshooting.problem: Segmentation fault on 5090 with WanVideoWrapper
troubleshooting.solution: Try without block swap node and torch compile node

troubleshooting.problem: Dimension mismatch error
troubleshooting.solution: Ensure same size in samplers and image_embeds, dim 3 should be height

troubleshooting.problem: Native multitalk not finding model
troubleshooting.solution: Place model in 'model_patches' folder, not diffusion_models

troubleshooting.problem: WanVideo Apply NAG causing issues with Wan 2.1
troubleshooting.solution: Remove/disable WanVideo Apply NAG when using Wan 2.1

troubleshooting.problem: Lost previews on sampler v2 nodes and VHS nodes
troubleshooting.solution: Download missing taew2.2 file (needed for 5B model), change UI framerate settings, refresh browser multiple times

troubleshooting.problem: Color drift when loading videos with VHS
troubleshooting.solution: Use VHS Load Video (FFmpeg) instead of regular VHS loader to avoid pink/magenta color shift

troubleshooting.problem: RuntimeError with SCAIL: shape invalid for input
troubleshooting.solution: Ensure dimensions are multiples of 32

troubleshooting.problem: Frame misalignment in SVI extension reassembly
troubleshooting.solution: Set correct frame overlap - use 5 frames for one latent (4 per latent +1 bonus), not 4 frames

troubleshooting.problem: Extremely slow T5 text encoder loading (85s vs few seconds)
troubleshooting.solution: Check for RAM paging issues, though root cause unclear - normal load should be few seconds

troubleshooting.problem: Color drift when loading videos for extension workflows
troubleshooting.solution: Use VHS FFmpeg Load Video node instead of regular VHS Load Video or Native Load Video nodes

troubleshooting.problem: SCAIL execution order issues with Video Combine
troubleshooting.solution: Use dummy connections or node ID ordering to ensure proper execution sequence

troubleshooting.problem: SCAIL OOM issues with context windows
troubleshooting.solution: Use only 1 prefetch and adjust block swap settings, disable context windows for shorter videos

troubleshooting.problem: Transformers v5 breaking Florence2
troubleshooting.solution: Downgrade to Transformers 4.57.3

troubleshooting.problem: Merged LoRA models causing errors
troubleshooting.solution: Re-merge LoRAs using ComfyUI nodes to fix compatibility issues

troubleshooting.problem: WanSelfAttention.normalized_attention_guidance() takes 3-4 arguments but 8 given
troubleshooting.solution: Disable WanVideo Apply NAG node

troubleshooting.problem: SkyReels V3 R2V won't work as-is with KeyError 'blocks.0.self_attn.k.weight'
troubleshooting.solution: Model uses diffusers keys, needs conversion

troubleshooting.problem: Clip loader breaking with mat1 and mat2 error
troubleshooting.solution: Uninstall and reinstall transformers==4.48.0 tokenizers==0.21.0

troubleshooting.problem: Negative prompts not working with distill LoRAs at CFG=1
troubleshooting.solution: Add NAG to workflow or use delayed negative prompting method

troubleshooting.problem: ComfyUI merge issues with SkyReels - 'Linear' object has no attribute 'weight_scale'
troubleshooting.solution: Unknown fix mentioned but not provided

troubleshooting.problem: SVI math for frame overlap causing misalignment
troubleshooting.solution: Use default 5 frames, formula should be 4 * latents + 1

troubleshooting.problem: Easy Use pack prevents sampler preview from showing
troubleshooting.solution: Enable 'model preview thumbnails' setting in Easy Use to fix the preview

troubleshooting.problem: Slow LoRA loading from disk
troubleshooting.solution: Update safetensors pip package to fix slow loading issues

troubleshooting.problem: Cannot merge VACE with Skyreels model
troubleshooting.solution: It's because it's scaled fp8 model, can't really merge it that simply

troubleshooting.problem: Ghosting effect in SVI Pro generations
troubleshooting.solution: Use smootherstep_blend instead of linear for overlapping to reduce artifacts

troubleshooting.problem: MOVA OOM even with 96GB VRAM
troubleshooting.solution: Select 'cpu' in offload mode instead of 'none' to avoid OOM

troubleshooting.problem: NVFP4 conversion requires both models loaded using around 20GB VRAM
troubleshooting.solution: After load, generations are about 30% faster despite initial VRAM usage

comparisons.verdict: Truly amazing, can generate each clip separately for preview before merging, much more efficient workflow
wan2.2_i2v_A14b_high_noise_lightx2v_4step_1030.safetensors and wan2.2_i2v_A14b_low_noise_lightx2v_4step.safetensors full models are the best at 6 steps with euler
VACE 2.1 still beats 2.2 Fun VACE for multi-frame interpolation

comparisons.comparison: I2V vs T2V for prompt adherence
comparisons.verdict: T2V model better understands prompts and can be used to reprocess I2V videos with Res4lyf to improve quality and prompt comprehension

comparisons.comparison: Native vs WanVideoWrapper for SVI 2.2 Pro
comparisons.verdict: User found wrapper works better after native runs were wonky
Full model is more consistent but slower, LITE model is faster and offers more variety with same prompt

comparisons.comparison: Open source vs Gemini for video understanding
comparisons.verdict: Open models are very substantially weaker than Gemini, but with finetuning on local video LLM you can beat Gemini on narrow tasks
RunPod much faster - 5 seconds per image vs 60 seconds on Vast instance

comparisons.comparison: SVI vs InfiniteTalk for endless generation
comparisons.verdict: InfiniteTalk seems to actually be infinite over minutes, SVI can be too if you don't diverge from anchor frame too much
Holocine not worth it anymore with SVI available
19B parameters, should fit in 24GB, comes with 4-8 step distilled models
2.2 low performs better than 2.1, swapping models doesn't break workflows, surprisingly compatible
LTX-2 nowhere close to replacing Wan for I2V, Wan still king for many things especially pose fidelity and lipsync. Nothing touches WanAnimate and SCAIL for pose fidelity

comparisons.comparison: Stock GGUF with 1030 lora vs wan remix checkpoint
comparisons.verdict: Checkpoint merges add more motion but mess with likeness

comparisons.comparison: With tile vs without tile CLIP vision
comparisons.verdict: Tile can cause problems in some cases, without tile sometimes produces better results with more accurate likeness
WAN understands human anatomy way better, LTX does weird stuff and 'bollywoods everything'
Switched to WAN because it got so much extra stuff added
SVI way better than VACE but suffers from color/brightness shift and degradation. VACE has color shift issues

comparisons.comparison: Different video models for best results
comparisons.verdict: Best might be Cosmos but only for robot and car videos

comparisons.comparison: LTX-2 with WAN Low feels like WAN 2.6
comparisons.verdict: Combining LTX-2 with WAN low produces results that feel like an unreleased WAN 2.6
User found LTX2V compelling enough to stop using Wan models recently
NVFP4 quality is between Q4 and Q6 gguf, size between Q3 and Q4, but 8x faster. Currently doesn't support ControlNet or LoRAs
SVDQuant is superior but requires careful calibration, which is the hard part preventing Wan implementation
LTX-2 is better in almost all aspects except Wan 2.6's cameo feature (reference video to video) which is pretty cool
Wan has better visual quality than LTX2, LTX2 wins on speed and audio support but Wan is better base model overall

comparisons.comparison: FP16 vs FP8 speed with Wan 2.2
comparisons.verdict: No speed difference noticed between FP8 and FP16, only switching between High and Low model takes longer
Wan has more tools and modalities but lacks native audio and long duration. LTX2 faster, smaller, longer videos but licensing issues prevent broad adoption

comparisons.comparison: Wrapper vs Native for Wan Animate
comparisons.verdict: Animate quality in wrapper is 5x better than native
LTX2 is faster, smaller, higher quality, longer videos - Wan really lost

comparisons.comparison: VHS loaders vs Native video loading
comparisons.verdict: Native is faster (19s vs 32s for VHS regular vs 55s for VHS FFmpeg) and has no color drift. VHS FFmpeg is most color accurate but slowest

comparisons.comparison: SCAIL vs VACE for pose control
comparisons.verdict: SCAIL is superior with 3D pose data vs VACE's basic pose control
SVI has much less quality loss and color drift than VACE, but both still exist to some degree

comparisons.comparison: SCAIL vs LTX2 for pose copying
comparisons.verdict: LTX2 better for facial consistency, SCAIL better for pose accuracy

comparisons.comparison: Klein 9B vs Nanobanana Pro for background replacement
comparisons.verdict: NBP significantly ahead for relighting and subject preservation
Stepvideo and Magi ranked first, Wan 2.2 considered king of local generation due to hardware requirements
Clear improvement in video quality with self-refine, especially for motion consistency
SkyReels V3 does some things differently but unclear if superior to LongCat Avatar
MOVA examples are much worse quality, limited to 8 seconds vs LTX2's 30+ seconds
MOVA looks sharper than Ovi, better sound, but Ovi has better visual quality overall
2.1 far from 2.2 quality with motion

comparisons.comparison: LTX2 vs other models for long video
comparisons.verdict: LTX2 absolutely on its own level for long video generation, can do 30s+ with same context
MOVA is about 1-2 seconds slower per iteration compared to Wan2.2
Quality of wan 2.5/2.6 is a downgrade from 2.2 in many ways due to shortcuts for speed
2.6 is bad but 2.5 is way better in quality, dialogue, motion, prompt understanding

comparisons.comparison: MOVA guitar vs stock wan + mmaudio
comparisons.verdict: Stock wan + mmaudio is better than MOVA for music generation

comparisons.comparison: Low quality InfiniteTalk vs other lip-sync methods
comparisons.verdict: Even low quality InfiniteTalk workflow beat the example shown
MOVA only about 1-2 seconds slower per iteration

comparisons.comparison: HuMo vs other methods for long generations
comparisons.verdict: HuMo can't natively do long generations

tips.tip: Use old 480 rank64 LoRA instead of 1022 for low model
tips.context: 1022 LoRA not good with low model, old one much better

tips.tip: Use 1030 LoRA for better motion than 1022
tips.context: For high noise model generations

tips.tip: Stride input frames to help with movement and speed
tips.context: Taking 1 frame every 15 from PNG sequence gives completely different, faster output

tips.tip: Use VACE for multi-keyframe interpolation instead of SVI
tips.context: SVI/2.2 isn't trained for multi-keyframe injection, VACE works better for that use case

tips.tip: Decode and re-encode latents for SVI anchor changes
tips.context: Last latent is actually 4 frames, not 1 - need to decode with VAE and re-encode to get single anchor frame

tips.tip: Always start with native ComfyUI, then WanWrapper if not available
tips.context: Avoid vibecoded custom nodes - most new features are quickly available in native or Kijai implementations

tips.tip: Use distill LoRA strength at 1.5 on high pass to counter slow-mo effect
tips.context: When using SVI Pro and experiencing slowmotion issues

tips.tip: Prompt aggressively to break away from anchor frame in SVI
tips.context: Lazy prompting will keep SVI stuck to anchor image due to its consistency mechanism

tips.tip: Find front-facing character view as anchor latent for T2V with SVI
tips.context: When doing T2V generations involving character appearance before SVI extension

tips.tip: Can regenerate anchor midway in long sequences
tips.context: For 10x 5s segments, you can do another anchor when you know something will change in the scene

tips.tip: Use two VACE encode nodes with different strengths for separate control
tips.context: One with control net and other with reference at different strengths when you want reference image to matter more than control video or vice versa

tips.tip: Use --cache-none to automatically release model and node cache
tips.context: When switching between workflows to prevent freezing

tips.tip: For non-standard characters, greatly expand the mask
tips.context: 20, 60, 100, 200 pixel masks show massive improvement with chibi characters

tips.tip: Position reference in same spot as pose video
tips.context: Helps with character consistency in Wan Animate

tips.tip: Use SCAIL to scale poses to match target proportions
tips.context: When working with non-standard character proportions

tips.tip: Padding to 300 + feet in frame helps A LOT
tips.context: For better character consistency

tips.tip: Modifying input video is more important than everything else
tips.context: After extensive testing with Wan models

tips.tip: Limit node pack count for better performance
tips.context: Running 120+ node packs causes slowest startup in the universe

tips.tip: Undervolt 5090 to 500W from 550W for safety
tips.context: Prevents power connector issues and overheating

tips.tip: Don't use model merges for purposes other than what they're made for
tips.context: Quality degrades, especially with AIO models

tips.tip: Use large masks with WanAnimate
tips.context: WanAnimate seems to prefer really large masks for better results

tips.tip: Add motion descriptions in prompts
tips.context: For avoiding slow motion in SVI, describe the motion in the prompt

tips.tip: Use 3 sampler setup for better motion
tips.context: First sampler without lightx and higher CFG, takes more time but improves motion

tips.tip: Generate at higher resolution for better results
tips.context: General observation that reasonably higher resolution yields better results

tips.tip: Try SGM-uniform scheduler for better motion
tips.context: User found motion improved when switching from euler/simple to sgm-uniform

tips.tip: Can mix WAN high motion with LTX-2 at 0.3 denoise for better results
tips.context: Using LTX-2 for v2v processing of WAN output

tips.tip: Use only WAN 2.2 low for upscaling with 2-3 steps
tips.context: Upscaling workflow, balance between frames per batch and resolution

tips.tip: Can upscale better in ComfyUI than any current paid upscaling service
tips.context: Using iterative captioned tiled upscale with Flux

tips.tip: Use res4lyf samplers with specific extra_options for efficiency
tips.context: default_dtype=float32, multistep_initial_sampler=euler, skip_final_model_call

tips.tip: LN is basically 2.1, HN is where the 2.2 magic is at
tips.context: Understanding WAN 2.2 model variants

tips.tip: Keep entire SVI system step count under 10 steps
tips.context: When using multi-sampler SVI setup with high and low noise

tips.tip: Use portrait crop of first I2V frame as SVI anchor
tips.context: SVI works best with closeup portraits for anchor frames

tips.tip: Disable hands in SCAIL for better quality
tips.context: When getting poor motion quality with hands flying away

tips.tip: Use reverse image batch node for progressive character entry
tips.context: When character only partially visible in initial frames

tips.tip: Use anchor frame changes and vary SVI weight/denoising for experimental effects
tips.context: When doing video extensions with SVI Pro

tips.tip: Some LoRAs can go to 2.0 strength but it gets very spicy
tips.context: General LoRA usage advice

tips.tip: Use higher order and/or multi-step samplers with momentum to use fewer steps
tips.context: For speeding up generation, moving from Euler to DPM allows using fewer steps

tips.tip: Train embeddings on Wan 1.3B with small images for speed, then transfer to larger models
tips.context: Since all Wan versions use same text encoder

tips.tip: Use character LoRA even with Wan Animate for likeness preservation
tips.context: Wan Animate still needs character LoRA in testing

tips.tip: Use 24fps for SVI-Pro2.2 output
tips.context: Works well in most cases for video generation

tips.tip: Full CFG always helps inpainting
tips.context: Even with empty negatives, but requires full steps (40)

tips.tip: Don't use face points with steadydancer
tips.context: Steadydancer doesn't have face control capability

tips.tip: Use higher distill lora strengths and proper CFG with 2.2
tips.context: Better than painter-like hacks for getting motion

tips.tip: Use shift=5 with Wan distilled loras
tips.context: They were specifically trained with this value

tips.tip: Save latents instead of video files for SVI extension
tips.context: When you want to preserve maximum detail between extensions and continue workflows later

tips.tip: Duplicate first frame several times to fix refine pass garbage frames
tips.context: Add duplicated frames at beginning, then trim after decoding to avoid garbage first frames in Wan refine pass

tips.tip: Use cfg on first step, no cfg on later steps method
tips.context: Still valid and recommended approach for sampling

tips.tip: Use VHS Load Video (FFmpeg) for color accuracy
tips.context: When you need to avoid color drift that occurs with regular VHS loader

tips.tip: Use restart sampling with many steps
tips.context: Start with 1000+ steps when experimenting with restart sampling for best results

tips.tip: Prompt character details when using SCAIL
tips.context: Important to describe style and character details when character is turning or moving

tips.tip: Use augment_empty_frames with self-refine
tips.context: Combine experimental augment_empty_frames feature with self-refine for more controlled motion

tips.tip: Save only necessary frames for SVI extensions
tips.context: For video extension workflows, only encode the last few frames needed rather than entire long videos

tips.tip: Use white padding for SkyReels V3 reference images
tips.context: When using reference images with the model

tips.tip: Self-refine sampling works better with more steps
tips.context: Because restarts add more noise than SDE samplers

tips.tip: Highly recommend upscaling pass for LTX2
tips.context: Due to very compressive VAE in spatial dimensions

tips.tip: Use delayed negative prompting for first third of steps
tips.context: Have blank negative for first portion of generation steps

tips.tip: SVI is not trained to continue from more than one latent
tips.context: Can have issues when trying to extend beyond default parameters

tips.tip: Use DWOpenpose instead of depth for VACE face work
tips.context: When doing subject transfer in videos, DWOpenpose will be closer to reference image than depth maps

tips.tip: Don't use DA 3 for VACE
tips.context: For VACE workflows, DA 3 made things worse than with DA 2 vitg

tips.tip: Test MOVA properly with correct settings
tips.context: Use 121 frames 24fps for proper testing since Hunyuanvideo foley doesn't support framerate other than 24fps

tips.tip: Use ComfyUI bridge node for FP8 text encoding
tips.context: When wrapper text encoder doesn't support FP8 scaled, use the comfy native text encoding with bridge node

tips.tip: Just converting to NVFP4 is very lossy - proper NVFP4 models need calibration
tips.context: When using NVFP4 conversion tools

tips.tip: You could use InfiniteTalk or MultiTalk with SVI for better results
tips.context: When doing audio-driven video generation

news.details: Preview bridge mask editor fixed for crop/masking workflows
Decent for low noise model

news.update: New omnivcus has newly trained VACE for 2.2
news.details: Haven't been tested yet but available
Can do climbing obstacles, fighting, crawling, playing instruments, climbing stairs/ladders. Adjustable runtime 1-12 seconds. Could pair well with Wan Animate
User looking for backup of deleted models
19B parameters, dev and distilled models (4-8 steps), joint audio-video training, ComfyUI support ready

news.update: LongVie2 added to Kijai's main branch
news.details: Depth controlnet for I2V models, can continue from 8 frames

news.update: NVIDIA bringing back RTX 3060 in Q1 2026
news.details: To tackle memory shortages

news.update: Flash attention now working on ROCm and Windows
news.details: Previously wasn't available for these platforms
New open source video model with audio support, 20 second generations, available on HuggingFace
New addition to help with fp8 and fp4 model support
New video generation model from ByteDance released on GitHub

news.update: HummingbirdXT - WAN 2.2 5B distill released by AMD
news.details: Lightweight VAE decoder that can substitute for WAN-2.2-5B VAE with reduced computational cost

news.update: VerseCrafter - world model based on WAN released by TencentARC
news.details: New world model architecture built on WAN foundation
New lip-sync/talking head technology

news.update: WAN team mentioned releasing lighter version 'for the community to use'
news.details: Suggests 20B-25B parameter model similar to WAN 2.2 coming
GitMylo released NVFP4 versions but quality may be degraded

news.update: UniPic3 CM models released by Skywork
news.details: Two distillation methods available: consistency model and DMD distillation
Invoke has gone full Adobe according to user

news.update: ComfyUI now supports asynchronous weight offloading
news.details: Allows better memory management by moving weights between VRAM/RAM asynchronously

news.update: New V-RGBX inverse rendering tool works in ComfyUI
news.details: RGB to albedo/normals etc, works with no code changes needed in ComfyUI

news.update: FlashVSR fork with bug fixes released
news.details: Fixes dropped frames, misaligned output, memory leaks, adds 1.1 support and frame chunking
Commit 16b9aabd52c3b81b365fbf562bbcc4528111ef6b merged into Comfy-Org/ComfyUI
RGnodes released for VACE and other video/mask needs
New model from Fudan-FUXI available on HuggingFace

news.update: StoryMem repo updated with RoPE fixes
news.details: Recent commit added missing RoPE offset implementation
Extension system now works with Wan 2.2 architecture at github.com/vita-epfl/Stable-Video-Infinity/tree/svi_wan22
Supports custom audio or TTS, posted to WAN resources

news.update: Memory optimization improvements for high res InfiniteTalk
news.details: New optimizations save 1GB+ VRAM for 720p+ generations
Early testing branch available on ComfyUI-WanVideoWrapper repository
New R2V, A2V, V2V models based on Wan architecture with multishot video extension
VHS developer confirmed the color space conversion issues and provided technical explanation
New model from lead HuMo developer, similar to OmniInsert but improved version
New reference-to-video model based on Wan 2.1 with 24fps capability
32B parameter video-audio model, actually Wan 2.2 A14B + audio, Apache licensed

news.update: Self-refine video sampling branch available for testing
news.details: New sampling method in development branch of WanVideoWrapper
Distillation training stuff featuring Wan, ~2 days old
Custom node available at HM-RunningHub/ComfyUI_RH_MOVA repo

news.update: Modulo support added to KJNodes calculator
news.details: Added modulo operation support to calculator node

news.update: Boolean output added to KJNodes calculator
news.details: Calculator node now has boolean output for comparison operations
Can upload a reference video of a person then do new videos of that person, no training at all

news.update: MOVA team roadmap includes API and HF space
news.details: They are making an API and HF space along with diffusers implementation

news.update: SVI 2.0 Pro branch doesn't have training code available
news.details: Team states 'We currently have no plans to open-source the training code' - only original 2.1 SVI has training code

settings.reason: Too high causes scene changes, needs tuning based on content
Makes generation super fast and uses less VRAM
Last latent contains 4 frames, need 5 minimum as first frame is different
Best performance for the recommended LoRA models
User running at this setting since March to help prevent power connector issues
Better results than 0 or 1 motion latents for T2V to SVI transitions
Standard training split between high and low models, important for LoRA compatibility
Usually works for smooth transitions in WanVideoBlender
Safer than full 550W, prevents power connector issues
Makes massive difference for non-standard character proportions
Best balance of time vs quality, takes 2ish minutes per gen at 1280x720
CLIP vision capped at 256x256, tiling allows seeing more detail
User found better results at 6 steps, 8 was too much

settings.value: Variable values shown in workflow image
settings.reason: Helps with motion control
Balance between quality and speed for upscaling
Good balance for video-to-video processing
Reduces memory usage and inference time
Helps combat stifled motion issues
Depends on input video motion speed
Avoids breaking LTX and SeedVR2 nodes
Good results for video extension, can test higher values
Higher values cause black output due to NaN tensors
When using HuMo as V2V second pass after SCAIL

settings.value: Only use CFG on first step
settings.reason: Trick to get more movement with lightx2v distill loras
Black Forest Lab's recommended number
Optimal split points based on sigma values
Effective for prompt adherence
Frame indices spread by factor of 5
Wan distilled loras were trained with this value
Correct formula is 4 frames per latent +1, not just 4 frames
Works well with SVI2.2-Pro though not officially recommended
Optimal VRAM usage for 4090, uses under 20GB
Default implementation increases model calls by 50% for quality improvement
Provides 2x speedup with ~90% quality retention
Prevents OOM issues when using context windows
Demonstrated working configuration
Based on duration * 24 + 1 formula
Proper mathematical formula for frame alignment
To avoid OOM with high VRAM usage
Official recommended resolutions
To properly continue from previous latent with 5 frame overlap
Default setting seems oddly high, worth experimenting with
Default setting used in examples
Test configuration for NVFP4 model

concepts.explanation: Helps with video continuation for keeping consistency, uses last latent from previous generation to continue
Mechanism that forces I2V generated frames to move further from initial input frame, useful for nudging I2V output in controllable manner
In SVI, refers to number of frames used for continuation - last latent contains 4 frames, first frame is separate reference
Vague marketing term used by custom node creators - likely refers to painter method but unclear what it actually does
SVI is biased towards less motion because it's always trying to get back to the anchor frame for consistency - this is how it maintains character consistency
ComfyUI mixed format includes info for each layer with settings like activation precision and whether it can use fp8 matmuls. Needs dict in model or quant keys
Method to mitigate quality degradation in extended video generation by providing reference point
Division between high and low noise experts in MoE architecture at 0.875 threshold
PyTorch issue affecting VAE decoding, related to CUDNN version, causes 3x memory usage
All-in-one model, refers to 2.1 model with multiple LoRAs baked in
Breaking images into tiles so CLIP vision can see more detail since it's normally capped at 256x256 resolution
Native refers to workflows built around KSampler from ComfyUI native, wrapper refers to workflows built around WanVideo Sampler from Kijai's repo
Wan 2.2 uses MoE architecture with separate high and low noise expert models, high model sets motion while low handles detail
VACE is not a LoRA but 'extra model layers' that plug into model loader differently than LoRAs
Cache becomes fragmented after long runs with diverse tensor sizes, making it hard to find contiguous blocks for new large tensors
Mathematical denoise by interpolation instead of extra model call, similar to how ComfyUI handles previews
PyTorch cache pool can have free memory but be unable to allocate due to fragmentation. Blocks need to be contiguous, free, and in same segment to merge.
Anchor frame is what you want the likeness anchored to throughout the video sequence, should remain consistent across segments
I2V model with 20 input channels, pose conditioning temporally concatenated at half resolution
ComfyUI feature that moves unused model weights to RAM while keeping active weights in VRAM, done asynchronously so it doesn't slow down generation if compute time is long
LoRA for Wan 2.2 that enables longer I2V generations by chaining segments together using frames from previous generation plus original reference image
Prompt adapters tend to be better for things requiring subtlety like character and style, and are lighter weight than LoRAs
Temporal positioning method where frame indices are spread by factor of 5, e.g. 3 memory images get -15, -10, -5 positions
Number of latents used by SVI node, typically last latent which represents 4 frames
Automatically sets split point based on sigma values instead of manual step selection
Uses anchor frames to prevent continuous drift - may drift initially but then stabilizes rather than continuing to degrade
Wan accepts frames according to formula 1 + 4 × n, where first frame is reference and then 4 frames per latent
Higher resolution increases signal at given noise level, so you increase shift to increase noise level for equivalent SNR
Technique using restart sampling with uncertainty masking to iteratively improve video generation quality
Masks areas that didn't change from previous restart in self-refine process, though naming is somewhat loose
Higher-order explicit Runge Kutta with exponential integrator, actually a bug fix of DPM sampler
Sampling technique that adds more noise than SDE, can be combined with SDE for both small per-step noise and big restart noise
Uses restart sampling with noise injection, can take you off known trajectory but SDE noise helps get back on track
Loading distillation LoRA on already distilled model causes excessive sharpening and artifacts
8x temporal compression makes fast motion difficult for diffusion model, especially human body movement
SkyReels concatenates reference images after noise, not before like VACE
Similar to restart sampler, implemented for video generation improvement
First generate a single clip, then extract keyframes with logic based on total length (limited to 200 seconds)
Returns the value of first input from first output, matches output to input
Magic that connects different modalities - 'you just connect up different modalities with some attn and magically it works'
Mostly down to cache misses, requires CUDA kernel analysis for proper performance analysis

resources.resource: SVI Pro native workflow by Kijai

limitations.limitation: SVI/2.2 not good for multi-keyframe injection
limitations.details: Not trained for keyframe interpolation like VACE, works worse than VACE for that use case

limitations.limitation: StoryMem only works for 2 shots
limitations.details: Shows glitches between sections even with many steps, not suitable for longer sequences

limitations.limitation: I2V prompt adherence issues
limitations.details: Still far from true prompt adherence, often just rolling dice on each generation

limitations.limitation: SteadyDancer has no face control
limitations.details: Cannot work with face images from pose and face detection nodes

limitations.limitation: SVI Pro tends toward slowmotion
limitations.details: By design due to anchor frame mechanism - requires aggressive prompting to break away from anchor

limitations.limitation: SVI reverts character changes like outfit/hair color
limitations.details: Due to anchor frame consistency mechanism pulling back to original appearance

limitations.limitation: T2V to SVI Pro transition issues
limitations.details: Difficult to get seamless transition between T2V video and first SVI Pro I2V - always some weird change in first few frames

limitations.limitation: HuMo compatibility with Wan 2.2
limitations.details: HuMo is trained on Wan 2.1 so workflows using Wan 2.2 HN stage are never completely perfect but work 'well enough'

limitations.limitation: Video models don't quantize well compared to LLMs
limitations.details: Video diffusion models have quality issues with quantization while LLMs are happy in 4 bit

limitations.limitation: SVI Pro only works with I2V models
limitations.details: Cannot be used with T2V models, not compatible with VACE

limitations.limitation: Video quality degrades over time with merged models
limitations.details: More noticeable with base + many LoRAs, degradation compounds with extensions

limitations.limitation: SVI still has some degradation and color shifts
limitations.details: After chaining many clips, despite improvements

limitations.limitation: LongVie2 hit and miss when start image isn't exact
limitations.details: Works better when using original video's first frame as start image

limitations.limitation: 5090 power connector rated for only ~20 reconnections
limitations.details: Terrible design, should avoid frequent disconnecting

limitations.limitation: PyTorch 2.11.0 has stability issues
limitations.details: Nightly build causes various problems including VAE decoding OOM

limitations.limitation: Wan 2.2 high+low requires significant RAM
limitations.details: Needs 64GB RAM, 32GB is not enough for both models

limitations.limitation: Wan slow motion issues
limitations.details: SVI can produce slow motion results intermittently, various factors affect this including LoRA choice

limitations.limitation: SCAIL memory intensive
limitations.details: NLF processor in SCAIL is memory intensive

limitations.limitation: Relight LoRA causes identity drift
limitations.details: Using relight LoRA in WanAnimate causes identity drift issues

limitations.limitation: LTX-2 bad at fast movements and small details
limitations.details: LTX struggles with fast movements and fine details compared to Wan

limitations.limitation: SVI has no controlnet or prompt control
limitations.details: Makes it too random for planned video shots compared to VACE

limitations.limitation: VACE only takes one reference
limitations.details: Cannot handle multiple references directly, people experiment with compound images

limitations.limitation: SVI flickering issues with end frames
limitations.details: Weird flickering artifacts when using end frames, different kind of bad when negative prompting flicker

limitations.limitation: LongCat Avatar can't use WAN LoRAs
limitations.details: No compatibility with existing WAN LoRA ecosystem

limitations.limitation: Wan 2.2 Vi Pro can't do proper end frame generation
limitations.details: Someone used different anchor claiming it's last frame but it's not really last frame generation

limitations.limitation: NVFP4 doesn't support ControlNet or LoRAs yet
limitations.details: Technology is currently half-baked according to user experience

limitations.limitation: Mocha doubles model input making it very slow
limitations.details: Mocha is extremely slow, taking about 1 hour for 81 frames

limitations.limitation: SCAIL hand detection isn't great
limitations.details: Hand detection alignment often screws up, especially on closeups

limitations.limitation: SVI Pro has color drift issues in longer generations
limitations.details: Common issue with color shifting over time, Color Match node only partially helps

limitations.limitation: HPS and MPS reward LoRAs break SVI generation flow
limitations.details: Can't use these LoRAs together with SVI Pro

limitations.limitation: SCAIL and HuMo can't work in same workflow
limitations.details: Need to run as separate passes

limitations.limitation: Current open source video models limited to non-HD 5 second videos with simple motion
limitations.details: Questioning what you can actually 'do' with current capabilities

limitations.limitation: Normal maps not officially supported by VACE
limitations.details: Not a trained VACE modality, though it somewhat works in practice

limitations.limitation: V-RGBX doesn't know what to do with sky, eyes/pupils
limitations.details: Generalization issues with certain scene elements, needs more AOVs like reflection/refraction

limitations.limitation: LTX2 licensing restrictions
limitations.details: Can't commercialize if competing with LTX company, revenue share required for paid licenses

limitations.limitation: Wan missing native audio and length
limitations.details: Only has Ovi for audio, no native long duration support

limitations.limitation: SVI 2 Pro motion issues
limitations.details: Stilted motion and reduced prompt adherence, loses SVI benefits below 60% strength

limitations.limitation: StoryMem high lora strength
limitations.details: Boosting StoryMem lora strength produces demon-like artifacts

limitations.limitation: SVI still has color drift and quality loss
limitations.details: Much better than VACE but both issues still exist, especially with extreme actions like faces going out of view

limitations.limitation: SVI only receives last X frames plus anchor
limitations.details: No awareness of objects or details that appeared earlier in sequence but not visible in recent frames

limitations.limitation: SCAIL masked operations not officially supported
limitations.details: No official masked SCAIL nodes exist currently, though theoretically possible

limitations.limitation: KJNodes GetNode can't work in subgraphs
limitations.details: Variables are scoped to each canvas instance rather than global, preventing subgraph use

limitations.limitation: Self-refine doesn't work well with distill models
limitations.details: Motion is defined too early in distill models for self-refine to be as effective

limitations.limitation: Self-refine incompatible with er_sde sampler
limitations.details: Cannot use self-refine technique with er_sde sampling method

limitations.limitation: SCAIL slow with context windows
limitations.details: Context windows make SCAIL generation very slow, better to disable for shorter videos

limitations.limitation: UniVerse-1-Base undertrained
limitations.details: Results show the model appears to be undertrained despite being 28GB

limitations.limitation: Magi model installation complexity
limitations.details: Requires special attention mechanism and is difficult to install, though not strictly necessary

limitations.limitation: SkyReels V3 based on older Wan 2.1
limitations.details: Not as good as Wan 2.2 for motion quality

limitations.limitation: MOVA limited to 8 seconds
limitations.details: Much shorter than LTX2's 30+ second capability

limitations.limitation: MOVA demo clips are poor quality
limitations.details: Examples shown are significantly worse than competing models

limitations.limitation: SVI is fragile due to training method
limitations.details: Trained using noise from specific generation setup, not very flexible

limitations.limitation: VAE compression issues for distant subjects
limitations.details: Very compressive VAE in spatial dimensions makes distant faces/objects require upscaling

limitations.limitation: MOVA requires reference image
limitations.details: Inference script requires --ref_path argument, may not support native T2V

limitations.limitation: MOVA doesn't support fp8 quantization
limitations.details: Code doesn't do fp8, uses bf16 on everything

limitations.limitation: MOVA installation complexity
limitations.details: Need weird dependencies that can conflict with protobuf, more complex than usual custom nodes

limitations.limitation: Skyreels Extend has fps issues
limitations.details: Movement is jerky/unnatural, lipsync feels off despite using 25fps

limitations.limitation: VACE with depth maps poor for facial features
limitations.details: Depth map doesn't have enough info for eye and mouth movement transfer

limitations.limitation: Scaled fp8 models can't be merged simply
limitations.details: Cannot merge VACE with Skyreels due to fp8 scaling

limitations.limitation: HuMo can't natively do long generations
limitations.details: Need to combine with other methods like InfiniteTalk or MultiTalk with SVI

limitations.limitation: NVFP4 conversion is very lossy without calibration
limitations.details: Simple conversion results in quality loss

limitations.limitation: SVI 2.0 Pro branch lacks proper documentation for Wan 2.2 training
limitations.details: Not well documented for training on Wan 2.2 instead of 2.1

hardware.details: Memory blows up after second extension during VAE decode, crashes after 3 hours of testing
76GB RAM gets frozen, need to restart pod frequently due to memory leaks
49 minutes for 15 videos (81 frames, 720x1280, 6 steps) with 123GB RAM and AMD Ryzen 9 9950X
16-pin connector problems causing melting/burning. Power consumption ridiculously high. Issues across brands (Gigabyte, ASUS, MSI)
Corsair RME series recommended over Great Wall 1250W 80plus gold which had issues
Not enough to run Wan 2.2 properly
19B parameter model should fit in 24GB with offloading
Regularly hits 85C, undervolting recommended for better performance
RunPod: 5 seconds per image, Vast: 60 seconds per image with Wan
At least 64GB recommended, some users have 128GB. 32GB minimum for hobby use with GGUFs. One user reported 60GB usage during 1080p LTX generation
Requires significant VRAM to run both models, can use low-noise only if limited
Windows has unified shared memory for temporary VRAM spikes, Linux is strict and causes instant OOM. WSL2 provides native Linux speed with Windows shared VRAM benefits
896x512 2-stage I2V+A at 25 FPS 30 sec took 18 min 40 sec without touching swap file
Might survive on 32GB if just playing around, not for serious work
30 minutes generation time on RTX 3060 for 93 frames at 832x480 with 12 steps
User reported 244GB/250GB RAM usage with Flux2, Wan2.2 models, VACE, SVI 2.0 Pro and LoRAs loaded
Mocha is 50% slower than base model due to doubling model input
SCAIL is about 50% slower because it halves pose image resolution
Can run on 16GB VRAM despite 53GB model size due to ComfyUI's weight offloading

hardware.requirement: VRAM requirements depend on model and system
hardware.details: Can't simply add VRAM and RAM together, depends on specific model and system configuration
10% speed improvement reported even with q4/q3 models when using block swap
VRAM usage significantly reduced through mask chunking optimizations
NAG will not increase memory use at all with new optimizations
Works fine but no major performance improvements, some users experience OOM errors
New optimizations save 1GB+ VRAM for 720p 81 frames, needs high resolution to be effective
Should load 11GB umt5-xxl-enc-bf16.safetensors in few seconds on good SSD like Samsung 990 Pro, not 85 seconds
Uses more VRAM than regular Wan, ~20GB for 720p with 30 block swap on 4090
Difficult to run newer models like Stepvideo and Magi due to 30+ billion parameters
Increases generation time by 50% due to additional model calls
55GB VRAM for 94 frames 720p, 72GB VRAM for 193 frames, 45GB RAM
1h15 gen time for 8 sec 720p video, 5 hours for longer generations
Around 20GB VRAM when both models loaded, but faster generation after load
45 seconds conversion time on RTX 5090
Acestep 1.5 requires about 4-10 seconds for 4 min generation

community_creations.description: Renamed node for difference augmentation in longer videos, applies augmentation per frame with scheduling

community_creations.creation: SVI Pro 2.0 workflow with multiple optimizations
community_creations.description: Combines SVI Pro + Longlook motion scale + RCM 2.2 + upscale/interpolation for budget VEO3 alternative

community_creations.creation: Fast Film Grain Node OOM fix
community_creations.description: Use Rebatch Images node before (240 or lower) and after (max value) Fast Film grain node to prevent OOMs
Fork of existing node used for making PR
Example workflow for using SVI v2 Pro with the wrapper
Comprehensive collection of Wan information, timelines, and LoRA recommendations
Addition to ComfyUI to help with fp8 and fp4 support
Shows generation time in bold format, more useful than checking terminal

community_creations.creation: Batch upscaler workflow for WAN 2.2 low
community_creations.description: Standalone batch processing for long videos with frame/resolution balance
Gradio app for automatic multi-camera editing synced to music using stem analysis
Nodes for chunk-based unlimited length video generation with re-do capability
Node that splits prompts and uses them on each run
Tool to rank/sort/rename faces for similarity comparison using deepface, helpful for dataset preparation
Workflow that handles multiple frame inputs including middle frames for music video creation
Node being developed to overwrite image sequences in same directory
VACE tailored nodes that also work for other video/mask needs
Proper RoPE offset implementation for StoryMem functionality
Reduces VRAM usage for high resolution InfiniteTalk workflows by 1GB+
Combines upscale model with lanczos downscaling to save RAM by avoiding intermediate caching
Right-click context menu to add commonly used nodes like GetNode with automatic connections
Implementation of self-refine-video technique for Wan models in ComfyUI
Workflow using color correct nodes to compensate for VHS color drift issues
Converted SkyReels V3 R2V model for ComfyUI compatibility
Custom script to convert diffusers format models, can strip quantization
Very long sequence generator with image batch joining for multiple premade chunks
